statute_citation: RSA Chapter 91-A - Access to Governmental Records and Meetings
notes: Strong presumption favoring disclosure. Right-to-Know Ombudsman available. Appeals to superior court with potential attorney's fees and civil penalties up to $2,000.

basic_request.subject: Right-to-Know Law Request - RSA 91-A
basic_request.body:
Dear Records Officer:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right-to-Know Law, RSA Chapter 91-A, I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following governmental records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

As required by RSA 91-A:4, please make these records available for inspection and copying no later than 5 business days after receiving this request. If you are unable to make the records available within this timeframe, please provide an estimated date and time when the records will be available and any fees that may apply.

If any portion of this request is denied, please specify the legal authority for the denial as required by law.

I understand that fees may be charged not exceeding actual costs. Please provide an itemized list of any charges in advance.

I prefer to receive responsive records in electronic format when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if you need clarification regarding this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: Right-to-Know Violation - Superior Court Petition
appeal_template.body:
TO THE SUPERIOR COURT:

Pursuant to RSA 91-A:7, I petition this Court for injunctive relief due to a violation of the New Hampshire Right-to-Know Law by [AGENCY NAME].

On [DATE], I submitted a Right-to-Know request to [AGENCY] requesting [DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]. The agency [DESCRIBE VIOLATION - failed to respond within 5 business days / denied request improperly / etc.].

This violation of RSA 91-A [CITE SPECIFIC SECTION] has deprived me of my right to access governmental records. The requested records are not exempt under RSA 91-A:5, and the agency has not met its burden of proving an exemption applies.

I respectfully request that this Court:
1. Issue injunctive relief requiring the agency to provide access to the requested records;
2. Award attorney's fees and costs pursuant to RSA 91-A:8;
3. Impose civil penalties up to $2,000 as authorized by law;
4. Order mandatory training for officials involved in the violation;
5. Grant such other relief as the Court deems just and proper.

Alternatively, I may file a complaint with the Right-to-Know Ombudsman at (603) 271-3277.

Respectfully submitted,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
